definition: literal/word by word and phrase by phrase
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China
sentence/clause/phrase/classifier for phrases or lines of verse

sentences.english: He went over our written material word for word to correct and improve it.
sentences.chinese: 他逐字逐句看我們寫的材料，幫助修改提高。

sentences.english: there is going to be a list of all the websites, and word for word.
sentences.chinese: 網上會逐字逐句地出現一串兒網址。

sentences.english: This report was read off word for word from the minute book.
sentences.chinese: 這篇報告是從記錄本中逐字逐句抄錄下來的。

sentences.english: They follow orders literally and unrelentingly.
sentences.chinese: 他們無情地逐字逐句地遵從命令。

sentences.english: He explains this regulation to me word for word.
sentences.chinese: 他逐字逐句地替我解釋這項條例。

sentences.english: He wrote his speeches word-for-word on paper, and practiced them.
sentences.chinese: 他逐字逐句在紙上寫下了演講稿，然後練習。

sentences.english: My point?The translator must not simply translate literally, word-for-word, as we say in English.
sentences.chinese: 我的觀點是，翻譯人員不能逐字逐句的翻譯原文。

sentences.english: With peals of distant ironical laughter at every word I have written.
sentences.chinese: 隆隆作響的反諷遙笑我逐字逐句記在心裏了去。
請逐字逐句地翻譯這篇文章。

sentences.english: Therefore the whole text may not into the brain, word for word.
sentences.chinese: 因此可以把整段的文字映入大腦，不必逐字逐句過目。

sentences.english: An expression that does not bear translation.
I learn the passage by heart and can recite it word -for- word.
sentences.chinese: 我很用心得學這段話，都可以逐字逐句的背下來了。
他逐字逐句地翻譯這段文字。

sentences.english: Many passages are identically the same, word for word.
sentences.chinese: 許多段落逐字逐句都是一模一樣的。

sentences.english: Reading a speech word for word.

definition: to study attentively (a book)/to delve into
see 一字不漏[yi1 zi4 bu4 lou4]
to annotate/to add marginal comments on/criticism/marginalia
ten lines at a glance (idiom)/to read very rapidly
to transcribe/to make a fair copy
